uk.ac.tsl.etherington.genomehelper.fastq

Class FastqInterlacer

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.tsl.etherington.genomehelper.fastq.FastqInterlacer

  • public class FastqInterlacer
extends java.lang.Object
    A FASTQ interlatcer class for interlacing and de-interlacing fastq files

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FastqInterlacer() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void deinterlace(java.io.File fastqFile, java.io.File leftPairedReads, java.io.File rightPairedReads, java.io.File leftSingleReads, java.io.File rightSingleReads)
      De-interlace interlaced fastq sequences into a file of left and right sequences
      void interlace(java.io.File leftReads, java.io.File rightReads, java.io.File fastqInterlacedFile, java.io.File fastqSinglesFile)
      Interlaces fastq sequences, where it is uncertain that each pair has a corresponding ordered mate
      void interlaceKnownPairs(java.io.File leftReads, java.io.File rightReads, java.io.File fastqInterlacedFile)
      Interlaces fastq sequences, where it is known that each sequence has a corresponding mate in the same order
      void printFastq(java.io.File fastqFile)
      A helper method to print out the sequence ids in a fastq file

    • Method Detail

      • interlace

        public void interlace(java.io.File leftReads,
             java.io.File rightReads,
             java.io.File fastqInterlacedFile,
             java.io.File fastqSinglesFile)
        Interlaces fastq sequences, where it is uncertain that each pair has a corresponding ordered mate
        Parameters:
        leftReads - the left-handed fastq reads
        rightReads - the right-handed fastq reads
        fastqInterlacedFile - the interlaced paired fastq files
        fastqSinglesFile - orphan fastq sequences that don't have a corresponding pair

      • interlaceKnownPairs

        public void interlaceKnownPairs(java.io.File leftReads,
                       java.io.File rightReads,
                       java.io.File fastqInterlacedFile)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Interlaces fastq sequences, where it is known that each sequence has a corresponding mate in the same order
        Parameters:
        leftReads - the left-handed fastq reads
        rightReads - the right-handed fastq reads
        fastqInterlacedFile - the interlaced paired fastq files
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • printFastq

        public void printFastq(java.io.File fastqFile)
        A helper method to print out the sequence ids in a fastq file
        Parameters:
        fastqFile - the fastq file for which the sequence ids should be printed

      • deinterlace

        public void deinterlace(java.io.File fastqFile,
               java.io.File leftPairedReads,
               java.io.File rightPairedReads,
               java.io.File leftSingleReads,
               java.io.File rightSingleReads)
        De-interlace interlaced fastq sequences into a file of left and right sequences
        Parameters:
        fastqFile - the interlaced fastq file
        leftPairedReads - the left-handed reads from the interlaced fastq file
        rightPairedReads - the right-handed reads from the interlaced fastq file
        leftSingleReads - the unpaired left-handed reads
        rightSingleReads - the unpaired right-handed reads
